name: Puffy Roberts
text: I duh self stuck a$10 bill in the machine that plainly states takes only 1s and 5s.. well it got hung up wouldnt give it back. Or change or ice. Call the number list in case of problems. He got back with me asap. Next morning he called me letting me know that the 10 was toast..And then he refunded me my 10 bucks and have me 5 tokens for bags of ice value $10. I am so shocked.. above and beyond.. So plz support your local merchants. And no bull that ice holds up way better then the others junk. Thank you

name: Jared Murphree
text: Took my money then never gave me a refund. Guess the next person gets a bag on me. Absolutely garbage! I will never use them again. I've never had problems in the past but no more!

name: david schofield
text: I have been twice, and both times been robbed. I put my money in and did not get any ice. It took $4 to get less ice than what I get out of my fridge at home. Called # for service and have gotten no response about it taking my money and not giving ice. This place is crooked

name: Glenn Rayburn
text: Huge bag of ice for less than the smaller bags in stores. Customer service phone number on the machine is very helpful if you have any problems.

name: Zach Rutledge
text:
Not a bad little place to stop for a bag of ice. It’s a better deal than buying at a convenience store or supermarket, and so far the quality of the ice has been very good.  I like that there are multiple options: you can get 16 lbs in a plastic bag or 20 lbs if you bring your own container, for the same price.

The tap to pay actually works, which makes the process pretty easy.  My only real complaint is the lighting around the building is not great.

name: Matt DeBlaey
text: Last time I was here, they only took cash. Most of these take a card at this point. Hopefully they upgraded it since.

name: TD Howard Family
text:
We use this ice station weekly
Best price for bulk ice in the nearby area.

name: Chuck
text: It's like everything else that's on the part of town.
